data.title: NYC's green monster
data.text: This is the  centerpiece of NYC government. Any office building with ugly city green walls. . Not known or  thought of by most NYer's as a tourist attraction.

data.title: They don't build 'em like this anymore.
data.text: This municipal building near City Hall which houses offices for city personnel is the very definition of the expression: "They don't build 'em like this anymore"  It is replete with statuary and other timeless architectural frills which would be just too expensive to replicate these days.

data.title: gorgeous statuary great history,see thegold statue on the roof there since 1914
data.text:
great history of nyc government ofices great architecture,famous statue on top,solid gold plated
a look back at a different time in history

data.title: The City Building of New York
data.text: This building is where i got marry at in 1979, of September, on the 28th day, and this building have lots of city and state agency in the building for offices and this building is a land mark building

data.title: Just Look Up!
data.text: If you are visiting New York, there probably aren't many reasons why you would go in this building....except for one: this is where you can get married in Manhattan! No fuss, no muss--get the marriage license in one drab office, get married a day or two later in another! With a line of people behind you! They've made it nicer (I got married here 12 years ago, my best friend brought flowers from a deli, and we walked part way across the Brooklyn Bridge, which is just outside), but the main thing is: it's cheap, it's simple. Take your friends out for a nice lunch after (we did!). Married already? Great, that makes it easier. So except for looking up at the arched brick of Gustavino (famous for his arched ceilings--check out Grand Central's ceilings in the corridors to the side of the main room) ceilings on the Brooklyn Bridge side of the building's street level, and maybe hitting the NYC themed gift shop....you're done!

data.title: Nice, isn't it?
data.text:
We walked from Wall Street all the way to here. 
It is a huge building, impressive structure though. :-)

data.title: The NYCity souvenir shop here is super. Handy location on top of a subway station.
data.text: This isn't one of the city's great buildings, but it was considered so good when it was built that it became a model for a good many official Russian buildings after the Communists took over and wanted to look Modern. One of the best things here is that it sits right on top of a subway station, so it's easy to get to. And why get to it? If you're a tourist, you can hardly find better city souvenirs than in the shop on the ground floor of this building. Some are humorous, some are charming, some are what you see in trashy shops around town but they're of better quality here. Toys, books about the city, puzzles all kinds of things for kids and grownups.. If you can find an excuse to go high upstairs inside this building, you'll have fine views from the windows.

data.title: Interesting architecture in lower Manhattan
data.text: When you're visiting Lower Manhattan, perhaps to see the 9/11 Memorial or the Wall Street area, continue north on Broadway to take in the churches, City Hall (and its beautiful little park), and to east of these, the Municipal Building (with it's famous statue at the top) and, just north of this, the great courthouses of the City of New York.

data.title: Impressive structure
data.text: I didn't know what this was at first, thought it might have been a hotel until I saw a sign.  The amount of work and detail into this building was superb, though I didn't go in, just walking around the outside was enough.  Well worth a look if you're heading to the financial district.

data.title: simply stunning
data.text: loved the municipal building. simply stunning. very grand and well worth a visit we actually have been to see it everytime we have gone to NYC as it it truly mind blowing

data.title: Nice architecture
data.text: A very nice building in a very nice neighborhoud. Not that touristic, but very interesting with lots of things to do. We spend some time there during a rainy day and it was really beautiful.

data.title: One of the most beautiful building in New York
data.text: When I lived in Brooklyn, I always enjoyed looking at the building while I crossed the Manhattan Bridge on the subway. Never knew much about the builiding until I walked around the building and through the awesome arch and got to see all the intricacies. A 40 story building, it actually stands out quite well with the other buildings that are around it. I really recommend getting to take a closer look of this gorgeous landmark.

user_location.name: New York, New York, United States

data.title: Statue Atop Municipal Bldg - Her name is Audrey Munson
data.text: The Statue Atop Municipal Bldg - Her name is Audrey Munson, althugh the statue is also called 'Civic Frame'. Read up on Audrey Munson - America's First Supermodel.

data.title: One of the largest government buildings in the world
data.text:
The Manhattan Municipal Building was designed in the Italian Renaissance style. On top of the central tower is a 20-foot tall statue known as 'Civic Fame'.

The Municipal Building was completed in 1915 and the mayor of New York also keeps his office in this building.

The Building is also famous for weddings and approximately 30,000 New Yorkers are married each year in civil ceremonies that last about 4 minutes. Its location near the Brooklyn Bridge and on its way to the Financial district means it is hard not to miss.

data.title: Views!
data.text: We got married here.  Fantastic views of Brooklyn Bridge from ladies loo. Arches used to be old pedestrian walkway to the bridge. Well worth a visit if you like archecture.

data.title: Not Really A Tourist Attraction
data.text:
The Muni building is not actually an attraction in NYC.
Apart from its Architecture.
It sits next to the Brooklyn Bridge and is a prominent structure in the downtown Manhattan
skyline.
It is across the street from City Hall.
It is a place of business and houses a lot of the City's Departments.
The one interesting thing is that the statue atop of the building is the second largest statue in NYC. The first being the statue of Liberty.

data.title: one of our best
data.text: It is a beauty.  Especially is you don't have any business there.  It has everythng.  Take a tour.  Worth the time

data.title: Mixed feelings about a major landmark
data.text: A hundred year old landmark of civic architecture.  A mix of beautiful neoclassical elements and a prominent mark on the lower Manhattan Civic Center skyline on an otherwise ungainly massive struture in great need of renovation.

data.title: It's a beautiful structure, but not really a destination.
data.text: On your way to the Brooklyn Bridge, do look at the architecture.  But there's nothing other than municipal offices inside.

data.title: Old Building
data.text: Like a lot of other buildings. Not Iconic. Has a very low profile in New York City.
